headline: Starbucks accelerates new staffing model to all North American stores
summary: (Reuters) -Starbucks CEO Brian Niccol told Reuters on Tuesday that he would accelerate the rollout of the coffeehouse chain's new staffing and service model, aiming for all 18,000 North American stores by summer's end, rather than the initial plan for just a third of U.S. stores by year-end.  Niccol says the model is a foundational element of his turnaround strategy for the company, as he bets on an improved in-store customer experience to reclaim the sales growth that has eluded Starbucks in recent quarters.  Niccol said early tests of the model have sped up service times and grown sales, without providing specifics.

Niccol says the model is a foundational element of his turnaround strategy for the company, as he bets on an improved in-store customer experience to reclaim the sales growth that has eluded Starbucks in recent quarters. headline: Starbucks is hiring full-time content creators to travel the world and post on social media
summary: The ‘global coffee creator’ role pays a full-time salary and includes travel to international Starbucks locations, with expenses covered by Marriott and Delta.

headline: Starbucks reduces prices on tea-based drinks in China
summary: The move is designed to appeal to the Chinese market's demand for non-coffee offerings.

raw.headline: Starbucks reduces prices on tea-based drinks in China
raw.summary: The move is designed to appeal to the Chinese market's demand for non-coffee offerings.

headline: Leadership Experience 2025: Starbucks Rallies 14,000 North America Coffeehouse Leaders to Accelerate its ‘Back to Starbucks’ Strategy
summary: LAS VEGAS, June 10, 2025--This week, Starbucks is hosting over 14,000 coffeehouse leaders from across North America at Leadership Experience 2025 in Las Vegas.
